title: Challenge 2: Fix Code with Ruff Rules
description:
Given a Python file with multiple code quality issues, identify what Ruff would flag and manually fix each issue. This exercise helps you understand what each rule category catches.

**Rules to apply:**
- F401: Remove unused imports
- F841: Remove unused variables  
- E225: Add whitespace around operators
- UP006: Use modern type hints (list instead of List)
- SIM103: Return condition directly
- I001: Sort imports correctly
instructions: Fix all the code quality issues in the given code snippet.

hints.text: Start by removing unused imports (os, sys, Optional). Keep only json since it might be used.
For SIM103, if you're returning True/False based on a condition, just return the condition itself.
UP006: In Python 3.9+, use list[str] instead of List[str] from typing.

commonMistakes.correction: Remove Optional if not used in type hints
Replace if/else True/False with return condition
Use built-in list[str] instead of List[str]
